title: Unai Emery breaks silence on Granit Xhaka captaincy as he explains he's "devastated"

Unai Emery has refused to confirm whether he will strip Granit Xhaka of the Arsenal captaincy.

The Gunners midfielder had a run-in with supporters when his number was called at the Emirates during Sunday's 2-2 draw with Crystal Palace.

An ironic cheer went up inside the stadium before fans began booing the Switzerland international off the pitch.

Xhaka reacted angrily to the reception he received and cupped his ears.

He was then seen shouting: "f*** off" before he ripped his Arsenal shirt off and stormed down the tunnel into the changing room.

Emery spoke to the press about the matter on Tuesday, but refused to confirm whether he would strip Xhaka of the captaincy.

(Image: ETIENNE LAURENT/EPA-EFE/REX)

He said: "At the moment I'm not speaking and I don't want to think about that.

"It's not easy for him and for the team. He is now devastated, sad. We spoke yesterday and Sunday night and this morning.

"He trained normally with the group but he is devastated. He is sad about that situation.

(Image: Visionhaus)

"His commitment is great every time. He wants to help. His behaviour was perfect in training, with the group and club. Really he knows he was wrong.

"He feels inside, very deep. It's normal as a human. Every player needs the supporters' support."

Xhaka has received both criticism and support following Sunday's match.

(Image: Reuters)

Senior Gunners players have reportedly visited him at his house to offer him comfort, while Emery spoke to him on the phone.

But pundits including former Arsenal stars Ian Wright and Charlie Nicolas have hit out at the midfielder's actions.

"Players getting booed is not the best, but this is the captain," said Wright on Match of the Day.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"They are frustrated that he hasn't run off the pitch. I've seen him before bolt off when he's substituted. He's walked off and then he goads them.

"We're talking about fans who have watched him play a handful of good games in three years. And he's treating them like that."
description: The Arsenal midfielder had a run-in with the Gunners supporters during Sunday's draw with Crystal Palace
